discussion.content: Case and Account

Selected Answer: AD
An escalation template determines how an escalation request is processed and includes the type of escalation (case or account); an approval list or workflow (if approval is required), and an escalation watch list.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/create-escalation-template.html

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct.

questions.question_text: What types of escalation templates can be created? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Enforce customers to adapt their processes towards the baseline processes
choices.A: Give the customers the data they need so they can make an informed decision
choices.D: Engage with customers to gain deep understanding of their organization
choices.E: Guide the customer toward industry best practices
choices.B: Any financial implication of a decision should be handled by the delivery and sales team

questions.question_text: What is the specific type of catalog item called that allows users to create task-based records, such as case records, from the Service Catalog?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/c_RecordProducer.html

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Record Producer
A record producer is a specific type of catalog item that allows end users to create task-based records, such as incident records, from the service catalog.

Selected Answer: B
Explanation: CSA knowledge, in order for catalog items transform to any other table other than request (can't remember the table name) will require a record producer (think of it as a tranform map :P)

given answer is correct.
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwilzfKK0er7AhXdsVYBHUU7DR8QFnoECA4QAQ&url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.servicenow.com%2Fen-US%2Fbundle%2Ftokyo-servicenow-platform%2Fpage%2Fproduct%2Fservice-catalog-management%2Freference%2Fr_ExtendedCatalogItemFunctions.html&usg=AOvVaw1Ufz14Njnq_JNApKfOB4Ly

questions.question_text: Out-of-box, which functionality handles state transitioning for case management?
Which of the following are benefits of customer access management? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Correct answer is C, D --> https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

C&D
Customer access management:
Improves the customer experience by enabling related parties to track and collaborate on cases
Improves operational efficiency by enabling customers to track cases for products and services
Increases automation by automatically granting access to cases based on access to sold product

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

Selected Answer: CD
Improves the customer experience by enabling related parties to track and collaborate on cases
Improves operational efficiency by enabling customers to track cases for products and services
Increases automation by automatically granting access to cases based on access to sold product

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

Selected Answer: CD
CD is Correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

Selected Answer: CD
Explanation:
 - Improves the customer experience by enabling related parties to track and collaborate on cases (D.)
 - Improves operational efficiency by enabling customers to track cases for products and services
 - Increases automation by automatically granting access to cases based on access to sold product (C.)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

Selected Answer: CD
C and D

Selected Answer: CD
CD ARE CORRECT
CD are correct

choices.C: It increases automation by automatically granting access to cases based on access to sold product
choices.B: It increases security by automatically providing access to case information based on account hierarchy
choices.A: It defaults the responsibility for access management to the customer service agent.
choices.D: It improves the customer experience by enabling related parties to track and collaborate on cases.
choices.E: It defaults the responsibility for access management to the customer.
